summary: The text discusses the history of Jerusalem, also known as Jebus and Salem, later called Hierusalem and Hierosolyma after Solomon built a famous temple there. The city was destroyed and rebuilt several times, including destruction by the Chaldaeans, and later by Vespasian and Titus, and it was rebuilt by Emperor Hadrian, who also renamed it Helia. The text further explores why the Magi visited Jerusalem although Jesus was not born there, highlighting Jerusalem's significance as a royal city and religious center where they expected such an important birth.
